text.0: savitar god of all men hath sent upward his light designed for all mankind immortal.
text.1: through the gods power that eye was first created dawn hath made all the universe apparent.
text.2: i see the paths which gods are wont to travel innocuous paths made ready by the vasus.
text.3: eastward the flag of dawn hath been uplifted she hath come hither oer the tops of houses.
text.4: great is in truth the number of the mornings which were aforetime at the suns uprising.
text.5: since thou o dawn hast been beheld repairing as to thy love as one no more to leave him.
text.6: they were the gods companions at the banquet the ancient sages true to law eternal.
text.7: the fathers found the light that lay in darkness and with effectual words begat the morning.
text.8: meeting together in the same enclosure they strive not ofone mind one with another.
text.9: they never break the gods eternal statutes and injure none in rivalry with vasus.
text.10: extolling thee blest goddess the vasisthas awake at early mom with lauds implore thee.
text.11: leader of kine and queen of all that strengthens shine come as first to us o highborn morning.
text.12: she bringeth bounty and sweet charm of voices the flushing dawn is sung by the vasisthas.
text.13: giving us riches famed to distant places preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
